title: If you get a disorderly conduct citation, can you get in trouble with probation? - Quora
tags: Legal Issues and Law in Everyday Life

response.answer_text: If called the Agent immediately, before the police wrote the citation, you might only get a sanction; 30–60–90 days in jail for failure to use your head. If you failed to call the Agent you will get 90 days in Jail, on a sanction, if this isn’t your habit of disrespecting authorities or a revocation if there are additional charges. The Judge will decide to amount of time if more charges happen. Obviously you need to find better places to be, with people who want you to be successful, or you lose your chance to be under supervision and go straight to jail.

Of course. Being on probation means you cannot get into any sort of legal trouble at all, and now you have gotten a citation from the police. So, yes, you are in trouble. Your P O can violate you, and you will go to jail/prison and serve the rest of your orginial sentence.
